I'm back again with a new error. When starting Eclipse ( RC2 )and trying to
debug something the Debugger works ( i can walk through code step by step )but
the window where you can watch the variables doesn't show them and an error
Message appears with the hint that you can look into the .log File for more
Details. So at the end of the end there are the sessions of the log file from
today. Additionaly i append a Full Thread dump. Maybe it helps.

Here is some Information about my System:
I'm using Suse Linux 7.3
kernel version 2.4.20
1 GHz Athlon with 1 GB RAM

For my Eclipse Installation, i installed the following files:

eclipse-SDK-RC2-linux-gtk.zip
org.eclipse.cdt-200212181139-linux-gtk_1.0.1.bin.dist.zip

The 2.0.x is the latest released version. CDT 1.0.1 works with 2.0.x. There are 
changes in 2.1 that CDT hasn't support yet. I think that the first problem is a 
result of this incompatibility.
Regarding the second problem, you probably provided a wrong binary file. CDT 
analyzes the executable and starts the corresponding version of gdb. 
Use the "Search" button on the "Main" tab to select the executable.
You also need gdb 5.2.1 or higher.

I did what you sugessted, but nothing changed. I searched for the binary of my
Project ( with search from the main tab ) and selected the executable. Also I
checked my gdb version by typing "gdb --version" in the same consele I started
eclipse from. The result was "GNU gdb 5.3" what is higher then 5.2.1.
But this is not a Problem because I'm not using anymore Eclipse 2.1 (M4) but
Eclipse 2.1 RC2. So it would be interesting, if there will be a new CDT version
without compability Problems with Eclipse 2.1(RC2).
Changed the initialization of the C debug images. See bug 27782 for comments.

Mikhail, 

are you sure the problem is fixed, which version from cdt do i need to get rid
of the problem. For a time the problem seemed to be vanished primarily in
eclipse (RC2). But at the moment as well in eclipse (RC2) as in eclipse ( 2.1
final release ), i've got this error.
